Uses of Package
jrtr

  • Packages that use jrtr 
    Package Description
    jrtr
    A simple API to build 3D rendering applications.
    jrtr.gldeferredrenderer
    An OpenGL renderer with deferred shading implementing the jrtr interfaces.
    jrtr.glrenderer
    An standard OpenGL renderer implementing the jrtr interfaces.
    jrtr.swrenderer
    An renderer based on software rasterization implementing the jrtr interfaces.
    simple
    A simple 3D graphics application using the jrtr library for 3D rendering.
    simpleVR
    Simple VR application using VRRenderPanel to render onto VR glasses.
  • Classes in jrtr used by jrtr 
    Class and Description
    Camera
    Stores the specification of a virtual camera.
    Frustum
    Stores the specification of a viewing frustum, or a viewing volume.
    Light
    Stores the properties of a light source.
    Light.Type 
    Material
    Stores the properties of a material.
    MeshData.Edge 
    MeshData.Face 
    MeshData.Vertex 
    RenderContext
    Declares the functionality of a render context, or a "renderer".
    RenderItem
    A data structure that contains a reference to a 3D object of class and its transformation Matrix4f.
    SceneManagerInterface
    An interface declaration for scene managers.
    SceneManagerIterator
    An iterator to traverse scenes.
    Shader
    Declares the functionality to manage shaders.
    Shape
    Represents a 3D object.
    SimpleSceneManager
    A simple scene manager that stores objects and lights in linked lists.
    Texture
    Declares the functionality to manage textures.
    VertexData
    Provides functionality to specify 3D geometry in the form of triangle meshes.
    VertexData.Semantic
    Vertex data semantic can be position, normal, texture or color coordinates.
    VertexData.VertexElement
    A vertex element is an array of floats that stores vertex attributes, like positions, normals, or texture coordinates.
